semantic_title: Low Birth Weight and Immaturity Status Coding
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 16. Chapter 16: Certain conditions originating in the perinatal period > e. Low birth weight and immaturity status

content.full_text: Codes from category P07, Disorders of newborn related to short gestation and low birth weight, not elsewhere classified, are for use for a child or adult who was premature or had a low birth weight as a newborn and this is affecting the patient's current health status. See Section I.C.21. Factors influencing health status and contact with health services, Status. (Evidence: pg no: 74, L53-L56)
content.summary: P07 codes can be used for children or adults when their premature birth or low birth weight as a newborn is affecting their current health status (Evidence: pg no: 74, L53-L56)
key_concepts: Child or adult application (Evidence: pg no: 74, L54)
Historical premature birth (Evidence: pg no: 74, L54)
Historical low birth weight (Evidence: pg no: 74, L54)
Current health status impact (Evidence: pg no: 74, L54-L55)
Status code reference (Evidence: pg no: 74, L56)

detailed_rules.rule_text: P07 codes are used when premature birth or low birth weight is affecting current health status (Evidence: pg no: 74, L54-L55)
detailed_rules.explanation: These codes are appropriate for any age patient when their neonatal prematurity or low birth weight continues to have clinical relevance to their current condition (Evidence: pg no: 74, L54-L55)
detailed_rules.applies_to: P07 category for children and adults
common_applications: Adult with chronic lung disease related to neonatal prematurity
Child with developmental delays related to low birth weight

detailed_rules.rule_text: P07 codes can be used for children or adults, not just newborns (Evidence: pg no: 74, L54)
detailed_rules.explanation: Unlike most perinatal codes, P07 codes have extended applicability beyond the newborn period when the historical condition affects current health (Evidence: pg no: 74, L54)
common_applications: Adult encounters where low birth weight affects current condition

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify patient had premature birth or low birth weight as newborn
Step 2: Determine if this historical factor affects current health status
Step 3: Confirm clinical relevance to current encounter
Step 5: Consider additional status codes per Section I.C.21
